People Pleasing Isn't Good For Our Relationships Or Us

One of the most destructive traits any of us can have is people pleasing -- seeking the acceptance of others in order to feel good about ourselves.

Wanting to make others happy, putting others before ourselves are good character traits, but they become harmful for us when they get out of balance and turn into people pleasing.

When we make our mood and self-esteem (how we feel about ourselves) dependent on what others think about us we've entered into the dangerous waters of people pleasing. One of the things that makes the desire to please others so damaging for us is that it breeds resentment and anger that nobody cares the same about our needs.

Bill Cosby has it right. The key to failure is trying to please everybody. Be on the lookout for people pleasing being a motivator because it's an easy and dangerous trap for all of us to fall into.
